results.title: Dirty dancing
results.creator_credit: Emile Ardolino, Linda Gottlieb and Vestron Pictures
results.brief_description: The Summer of 1963 is one that Baby (Jennifer Grey) will never forget. While holidaying in the Catskills she stumbles across the daring and exciting world of the dancing staff; driven by the stirring music and sensual moves, known as “dirty dancing”. She becomes the star pupil of the handsome dance instructor, Johnny (Patrick Swayze), and finds herself becoming more that just his dancing partner. Cast includes Cynthia Rhodes, Jerry Orbach and Jack Weston.

results.title: Groundhog Day
results.creator_credit: Harold Ramis, Trevor Albert and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Have you ever had one of those days where you wished you could relive the day and do things differently? Wise cracking weatherman Phil, (Bill Murray) is living the same day over and over. It all begins when he is sent with other crew members to Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania to cover the annual Groundhog Day Festival; the one day of the year when the seasons weather forecast is decided by an animal. Initially they are to move out after the report but a snow storm leaves them snowbound. With no tomorrow and no consequences to face, Phil is eager to explore every fantasy and possibility, and he does. Trying to enamour himself to the producer Rita, (Andie MacDowall) proves harder than he thought, no matter how long he has to try. Also starring Chris Elliot, Brian Doyle-Murray and Stephen Tobolowsky.

results.title: Sleepless in Seattle
results.creator_credit: Nora Ephron, Gary Foster and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as a recently widowed architect with a young son who moves to Seattle on the East Coast of America to escape the painful memories of his life with his wife. Meg Ryan is a recently engaged journalist who believes she has found the perfect man in her fiancee. Its Christmas, the silly season and Hanks young son has called a talk-back show to try and help his Dad move on with life. Ryan hears his conversation with the radio announcer who calls him Sleepless in Seattle. His words strike a chord in Ryan who begins to doubt if her comfortable life is really all she wants. Thus begins a story of chance and double-chance and of finding true love. This one of the most enchanting romantic comedies ever created.

results.title: Universal soldier
results.creator_credit: Roland Emmerich, Allen Shapiro, Craig Baumgarten, Joel B Michaels and Corolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Vietnam soldiers Luc Devreaux (Jean-Claude Van Damme), and Andrew Scott (Dolph Lundgren) are killed in combat. Their bodies are used in a secret government experiment of mixing man with machine. The two were sworn enemies in life and the experiment was supposed to have erased all memories but they rediscover the fierce hate between them as two fighting machines battle one another to the death. Also starring Ally Walker, Ed O’Ross and Jerry Orbach. This video contains 11 minutes of extra footage not screened in cinemas.

results.title: The Owl and the pussycat
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark, Rastar Productions and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Felix (Segal) and Doris (Streisand) are two mismatched neighbours. Felix is a writer, and Doris a prostitute and performer in the 42nd street flick, “Cycle sluts”. They share the same apartment building and annoyance at each other; such as his incessant typing and her numerous male callers. Despite these difference the two become firm friends, facilitating some pretty amusing dialogue between the clash of cultures and morals. The soundtrack is performed by Blood Sweat and Tears. Alan Alda and Diane Sands played the two title characters in the Broadway production, which is based on the play “The Owl and the pussycat” by Robert Klein.

results.title: Starman
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An alien (Jeff Bridges) makes a stopover on earth when he encounters the Voyager 2 probe. By masquerading as a human he has the opportunity, if only for a little while, to live like an ordinary man. His arrival is quickly discovered by a young woman (Karen Allen) who develops feelings for the Starman and agrees to assist him in the 2000 mile journey it will take him to get home. Cast includes Charles Martin Smith and Richard Jaeckel.

results.title: The Crow
results.creator_credit: Alex Proyas, Edward Pressman, Jeff Most and Crowvision
results.brief_description: There is a legend that when a soul can’t rest, a crow can bring that soul back form the dead, to seek justice and make the wrongs thins right.. In the film which cost him his life, martial arts phenomenon Brandon Lee stars as a superhuman mystical hero who returns from the grave to exact revenge on the killers of his fiancee and himself. The film contains fantastic special effects, awesome action and a dark, cyberpunk setting. Lee was killed on the set accidentally in a manner similar to his father, martial arts legend Bruce Lee, so a stand-in was used to complete the filming.

results.title: The Crow: City of angels
results.creator_credit: Tim Pope, Edward Pressman, Jeff Most and Bad Bird Productions
results.brief_description: Sarah (Mia Kirshner), thought that Eric was the only one to be brought back from the dead to make the wrong things right. In this story from ‘The Crow’ anthology inspired by the character created by James O’Barr, a young father, Ashe (Vincent Perez) and his son are brutally murdered when they witness a gruesome killing. Ashe is brought back to life by the mysterious powers of the Crow, but is also aided by a human, Sarah, who knows about the crow legend. Ashe must seek vengeance on those who killed him so that his soul, and that of his son can be at peace. Also starring Iggy Pop, Richard Brooks and Thomas Jane.

results.title: Torment = L' Enfer
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Marin Karmitz, Cinemanuel, France 3 Cinema, MK2 Productions and S A CED Productions
results.brief_description: This highly successful thriller from one of France’s most renowned and revered directors is set in the countryside of South western France. Hoteliers Nelly (Emmanuel Beart) and Paul (Francois Cluzet) have a marriage made in heaven. Paul is proud of his exceptionally beautiful wife, and Nelly blossoms, radiating a heady mix of innocence and sexuality that is openly admired by their male customers. However, their happiness is threatened when Paul begins to spy on his wife and becomes convinced of her infidelity. His obsessive jealousy turns to anger, which erupts in a cruel and violent climax. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Billy's holiday
results.creator_credit: Richard Wherrett, Denis Whitburn, Tristram Miall, Billy's Holiday Pty Ltd and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Appleby Hardware store and its owner, Billy Apples (Max Cullen), are the unlikely candidates for becoming the newest singing sensation. Billy doesn’t have alot going for him; a wife that left him, a so-so business, a rather unsuccessful band that performs at the local watering hole (mainly because Billy is a rotten singer) and a daughter who disowns him. One night Billy witnesses a comet shower and his life changes when he discovers he can sing like Billie Holiday: overnight, Billy Apples becomes a celebrity. Fame renews the affections of his wife, but it also distances him from family and friends, leading Billy to question his new existence. Also starring Kris McQuade, Tina Bursill, Drew Forsythe, Genevieve Lemon, Rachael Coopes and Richard Roxburgh.
